page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: At one time{sheep fairs}were held on St.John's Common. Farmers came from outlying districts to sell their animals. For a long time the main industries of Burgess Hill were{pottery}and{ {brickmaking.}Many streets and public houses still bear the names which show the one-time importance of these activities. There were only two schools in 1898. At this time the laundry was an old farmhouse, we now have two launderettes. There were two blacksmiths in the town. A firm of wheelwrights, E.Hole and Son, founded at that time, still carries out modern work and renovations. There is in the town a{Local{History {Society}which studies the history of the area, has helped to produce books and helps preserve photos and records.
